newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Central Bank lowers mini-band on real.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank lowered its mini-band on the real by buying dollars at 1.0680 and selling at 1.0730 reais per dollar in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
The previous mini-band was set May 15 between 1.0670 and 1.0720. Today's auction was the fourth time this month the bank nudged the mini-band lower.

Today's result of the auction represents a 0.09 percent decline from the previous mini-band and is in line with market expectations. So far this month, the Central Bank has shifted the mini-band 0.42 percent lower.
In the last few months, the Central Bank has lowered the mini-band between 0.57 percent and 0.63 percent each month.
